intro: Alsodeia corylifolia, commonly known as the broadleaf alsodeia, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its compound leaves and umbellate inflorescences. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forested areas. Its leaves are broad and heart-shaped, while its small white flowers bloom in clusters. Alsodeia corylifolia is sometimes used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
